title: Phase Transition Risk
description: Detects when systemic acceleration exceeds natural adaptation timescales, creating risks of discontinuous collapse, chaotic instability, or forced emergence.
indicators: Critical Slowing Down: recovery times from disturbances increase, signaling a nearby phase shift.
Resonance Catastrophe: external forcing cycles align with natural frequencies, leading to runaway amplification.
Entropy Acceleration: rapid change produces rising energy waste, stress, and irreversibility.
Control Parameter Blowup: governing knobs (policies, protocols, rules) change faster than adaptation rates, pushing the system into chaos.
